events.message: The insured reported an auto accident involving their vehicle in a rear-end collision on the highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description of the incident involving the insured's car and another vehicle.
An agent was assigned to the customer's claim to provide assistance and ensure smooth processing of the accident case.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and sent confirmation to the policyholder.
The insurance agent requested accident photos, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The insured submitted all required documents including photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair invoices.
Investigation into the collision details began, including verification of liability and assessment of vehicle damage.
The internal investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and the documented damage matched the reported incident.
A settlement offer was proposed covering full repair costs plus a rental car reimbursement for the duration of the repairs.
The insured provided positive feedback appreciating the prompt response and the fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved based on all documentation and investigation outcomes, authorizing the payment process.
The payment for repairs and rental reimbursement was issued to the insured's designated account promptly.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all repairs were completed and the insured was satisfied.
